Makes a simulated pedigree using representative sires and dams

Source: R/makeSimPed.R
makeSimPed.Rd

For each id in allSimParents with one or more unknown parents each unknown parent is replaced with a random sire or dam as needed from the corresponding parent vector (sires or dams).

Usage

makeSimPed(ped, allSimParents, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

ped

pedigree information in data.frame format

allSimParents

list made up of lists where the internal list has the offspring ID id, a vector of representative sires (sires), and a vector of representative dams (dams).

verbose

logical vector of length one that indicates whether or not to print out when an animal is missing a sire or a dam.

Details

The algorithm assigns parents randomly from the lists of possible sires and dams and does not prevent a dam from being selected more than once within the same breeding period. While this is probably not introducing a large error, it is not ideal.

On this page

Developed by Michael Raboin, Terry Therneau, Amanda Vinson, R. Mark Sharp, Matthew Schultz, Southwest National Primate Research Center NIH grant P51 RR13986, Oregon National Primate Research Center grant P51 OD011092.
